headline: WESTLAWN AMERICAS OFFSHORE ANNOUNCES NEW COUNTRY ENTRY WITH ACQUISITION OF WORKING INTEREST IN Z-61, Z-62, AND Z-63 BLOCKS OFFSHORE PERU
summary: Westlawn Americas Offshore LLC ("WAO"), a portfolio company of the Westlawn Group ("Westlawn"), is pleased to announce the completion of a transaction in which it has acquired a 30% non-operated working interest in the Z-61, Z-62, and Z-63 blocks offshore Peru (the "Transaction"). The working interest was acquired pursuant to the Farmout Agreement signed previously between WAO's affiliate Westlawn Peru S.A.C. ("WAO Peru"), and Anadarko Peru Limited, a subsidiary of Occidental Petroleum Corporati

headline: Chevron and Israel to Build Gas Pipeline to Egypt
summary: Chevron and Israel have finalized an agreement to construct a natural gas pipeline from Israel's Leviathan gas field to Egypt, aiming to significantly increase gas flow to meet Egypt's rising energy demands.

headline: Top Oil Traders Vie to Buy Chevron’s 50% in Singapore Refinery
summary: Commodity trading giants Vitol and Glencore are preparing bids to acquire Chevron's 50% stake in Singapore Refining Company, as Chevron seeks to cut costs and reshuffle its downstream priorities.

raw.headline: Top Oil Traders Vie to Buy Chevron’s 50% in Singapore Refinery
raw.summary: Commodity trading giants Vitol and Glencore are preparing bids to acquire Chevron's 50% stake in Singapore Refining Company, as Chevron seeks to cut costs and reshuffle its downstream priorities.

headline: Israel and Chevron Ink Pipeline Deal Raising Gas Exports to Egypt
summary: Israel Natural Gas Lines signed an agreement to allow the Chevron-led Leviathan consortium to use the planned Nitzana pipeline to ship more natural gas from the Israeli offshore field to Egypt.

raw.headline: Israel and Chevron Ink Pipeline Deal Raising Gas Exports to Egypt
raw.summary: Israel Natural Gas Lines signed an agreement to allow the Chevron-led Leviathan consortium to use the planned Nitzana pipeline to ship more natural gas from the Israeli offshore field to Egypt.

headline: Exclusive-Vitol and Glencore set to make formal bids for Chevron's Singapore refinery stake, sources say
summary: Global commodities traders Vitol and Glencore are expected to make formal bids for Chevron's 50% stake in Singapore's second-largest refinery, five people familiar with the matter said.  The Switzerland-based firms were shortlisted this month and Chevron is seeking to receive final binding bids during October, the person added.  Vitol and Glencore, which have other refining assets in the Asia-Pacific, are keen to acquire more and boost trade volumes in the region, the sources said.

raw.headline: Exclusive-Vitol and Glencore set to make formal bids for Chevron's Singapore refinery stake, sources say

Vitol and Glencore, which have other refining assets in the Asia-Pacific, are keen to acquire more and boost trade volumes in the region, the sources said.
